intro: Cyperus reflexus, commonly known as the watergrass or slender flatsedge, is a flowering plant in the sedge family, Cyperaceae. It is native to wetland and marshy habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically green or brown in color. Cyperus reflexus is often found growing in shallow water or moist soil, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems. Its ability to thrive in wet conditions makes it a useful plant for stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in wetland areas.
